abstract: Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising service DoubleClick may alienate some of DoubleClick’s clients, who may fear that its new owners will end up competing with them, Forbes.com reported. DoubleClick’s privacy issues could also resurface if it joined with Google, a privacy advocate said.
lead_paragraph: Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising service DoubleClick may alienate some of DoubleClick’s clients, who may fear that its new owners will end up competing with them, Forbes.com reported. DoubleClick’s privacy issues could also resurface if it joined with Google, a privacy advocate said.

headline.main: Google’s DoubleClick Deal Raises Competition Questions
